title: Sri Lanka stocks gain over 1.5-pct at market open amid float
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka stocks surged over 1.50 percent minutes after market opened following the central bank’s move to float rupee to 230 against the US dollar last night (07), market data showed.
The main All Share Price Index gained over 170 points to 11,133.17, wiping out some of the losses made in the previous day.

The central bank announced late last night it is abandoning a 200 to the US dollar peg after printing money through multiple means which were making outflows greater than inflows, creating forex shortages and parallel exchange rates.
The bank is of the view that forex transactions will take place at not more than 230 rupees per US dollar.
The rupee is trading in the kerb market around 249 to the US dollar. Exporters have been selling unofficially around 245 to the US dollar.
LOLC Holdings, Expolanka and Bukit Darah were seen to be pushing ASPI up.
